title: This Guy Earns Rs 1.82 In A Month Working As A 'Fortnite Game Coach', Talk About Dream Jobs!
text:
'Do what you love and love what you do', they say, but in the real world, getting a job that gives you satisfaction both ways, is not always possible. For many video-game enthusiasts, the dream is getting paid to play and there are some who are actually living the dream.

Meet, 25-year-old Dean Ford from Scotland, who has made a career out of playing Fortnite and coaching people who love the game.

Twitter/LabBiBle

According to reports, Dean Ford - known as ‘Lostbean’ in the game world - usually picks up work through freelancing websites.

However a major chunk of his income comes from being a coach for Fortnite, to amateur players. His earnings go up to Rs 1,82,000 a month. Let that sink in.

"I would say it's a dream job, 'cause you make your own hours, you work for yourself essentially," Ladbible quoted Ford as saying.

"It's a good feeling knowing I can come up at any time, go hang out with my girlfriend, instead of working like a nine to nine job. It's just great working at home, working for yourself - you make your own hours, you make your own money," said Ford.

"I'm a little older now, I'm 25, so I've got a lot of responsibilities; I'm in my own place, I've got a girlfriend and the number of hours you need to invest into the game to become pro level is a lot of hours, I'm talking at least six hours a day,” he said.

Customers, ranging from 8-year-olds to 50-year-olds, are paying Ford by the hour for mastering the game.

"There's a lot of effort that has been put into the game. The company, Epic Games, they listen to the players, if there's ever an issue they fix it. They're constantly updating the maps so there's different things in the game."

Ford is well-aware of the fact that the Fortnite fever might be short lived and soon he won't making bucks out of teaching this game. However, he's sure that something else will replace it and he'll again find a way to make a living out of it.
